title: Statesman by Plato
description: Statesman (Greek: ΠΟΛΙΤΙΚΟΣ Latin: POLITICUS) discusses God's role in maintaining the Universe and describes the statesman as a good shepherd who promotes intermarriage between the orderly (rich) and courageous (poor). Painting: Eighty and Eighteen by John William Godward. Translated by Benjamin Jowett. Audiobook read by Geoffrey Edwards.

itunes:subtitle: Greek: ΠΟΛΙΤΙΚΟΣ Latin: Politicus discusses the specialized knowledge needed by a politician to wield political power effectively. The politics of state controlled reproduction are also discussed.
